title: PCT 10: Four Cree resist the Blackfoot
author: Coming-Day

sentences.original: kîtahtawê itah êh-ayâcik, êh-wîkicik nêhiyawak, mâwacihitôwak ê-sipwêhtêcik oskinîkiwak, iyâhciyiniwah êh-ntonawâcik, ê-wîh-kimotamawâcik otêmiyiwah misatimwah, kîspin mâka wâpamâtwâwi, pêyakowicih, ta-nipahâcik;
sentences.text: kîtahtawê ita ê-ayâcik ê-wîkicik nêhiyawak mâwacihitôwak ê-sipwêhtêcik oskinîkiwak ayahciyiniwa ê-nitonawâcik ê-wî-kimotamawâcik otêmiyiwa misatimwa kîspin mâka wâpamâtwâwi pêyakoyici ta-nipahâcik
sentences.english: Once where some Cree lived, the young men assembled to go out looking for Blackfoot, in order to steal their horses from them and, if they saw one alone, to kill him;
that was their intent.

sentences.original: êkwah kâ-wâpahk, kâ-pimohtêcik, têpakohp tahtwâw êh-nipâcik, êkoyikohk wâpamêwak iyâhciyiniwah itah êh-wîkiyit.
sentences.text: êkwa kâ-wâpahk kâ-pimohtêcik têpakohp tahtwâw ê-nipâcik êkoyikohk wâpamêwak ayahciyiniwa ita ê-wîkiyit
sentences.english: So on the next day they set out, and when seven times they had slept on the way, they saw some Blackfoot encamped.
They hid from them; the others did not see them.

sentences.original: êkwah êy-itohtêcik, êh-tipiskâyik, êh-otihtâcik itah êh-wîkiyit, apiwak êkotah, cîkih itah k-âyâyit.
sentences.text: êkwa ê-itohtêcik ê-tipiskâyik ê-otihtâcik ita ê-wîkiyit apiwak êkota cîki ita kâ-ayâyit
sentences.english: Then, at night, when they went there and reached the others' camp, they sat there close to where the others were.

sentences.original: nîso nâpêwak itohtêwak mîkiwâhpihk, misatimwah êh-kimotamawâcik, êh-nipâyit.
sentences.text: nîso nâpêwak itohtêwak mîkiwâhpihk misatimwa ê-kimotamawâcik ê-nipâyit
sentences.english: Two men went to a lodge and stole the horses while the owners slept.

sentences.original: êkosi owîcêwâkaniwâwah êh-mâh-miyâcik, ômisiy itwêwak : têhtapik; tapasîtân.
sentences.english: Then, when they gave them to their comrades, they said, “Mount; let us flee.”
Accordingly they mounted to depart.
Two youths were dissatisfied with the horses they had got;
they did not like the horses, because they were ugly.
They let them go and would not flee.
“Why do you not flee?”
“I shall not flee.
Go, you others.”
So those who were on horses fled.

sentences.original: kotakak nîso nâpêwak mîn êwakonik namoya tapasîwak.
sentences.text: kotakak nîso nâpêwak mîna êwakonik namôya tapasîwak
sentences.english: Two other men also did not flee.
Thus they were four who did not flee.

sentences.original: kiwîh-wîcêtinâwâw, oskinîkîtik, itwêw awa kisêyiniw pêyak, mâskôc otinâyêko misatim, êh-itêyimitakok.
sentences.english: “I shall go with you, youths,” said one, an old man, “for I think you may perhaps succeed in getting a horse or so.”

sentences.original: êkosi êkwah ôki êkâ kâ-tapasîcik nîso ôskinîkiwak itohtêwak, iyâhciyiniwah itah êh-wîkiyit.
sentences.text: êkosi êkwa ôki êkâ kâ-tapasîcik nîso oskinîkiwak itohtêwak ayahciyiniwa ita ê-wîkiyit
sentences.english: Then the two youths who had not fled went to where the Blackfoot were camping.
They were still asleep.
They took twenty-one  handsome horses.

sentences.original: êkwah owîcêwâkaniwâwah, nîso itah êh-pêhikocik ôhi kisêyiniwah otihtêwak.
sentences.text: êkwa owîcêwâkaniwâwa nîso ita ê-pêhikocik ôhi kisêyiniwa otihtêwak
sentences.english: Then they went back to where their two companions, one of them the old man, were awaiting them.
The one gave a horse to the old man.

sentences.original: awah oskinîkiw ômisi isiyîhkâsôw : kiyâhkâkiyowêw, kâ-miyât kisêyiniwah êh-miyosiyit misatimwah.
sentences.text: awa oskinîkiw ômisi isiyîhkâsôw kiyâhkakiyôwêw kâ-miyât kisêyiniwa ê-miyosiyit misatimwa
sentences.english: The name of the youth was Kiyahkakiyowew, he who gave the old man a fine horse.

sentences.original: êkosih ômisih itwêw awa kisêyiniw : kitatamihin, wêskinîkiyin.
sentences.english: Then the old man spoke thus: “I thank thee, youth.
It was for this I stayed with thee.”

sentences.original: êkos êwakw âwa kisêyiniw omis îsiyihkâsôw : tawipîsin isiyîhkâsôw.
sentences.text: êkosi êwako awa kisêyiniw ômisi isiyîhkâsôw tawipîsim isiyîhkâsôw
sentences.english: The name of this old man was Tawipisin.
“Now let us flee,” said the old man.
Accordingly they mounted and made for home.

sentences.original: ômis îtwêw awah kisêyiniw : oskinîkîtik, êkâ wiyah pimitisahwâtânik kiwîcêwâkaninawak.
sentences.english: Thus spoke the old man: “Young men, let us not go in pursuit of our companions.
Let us go in a different direction.
They have many horses.
Tomorrow the Blackfoot will pursue them.
No doubt they are far on their way by now.
It is us whom the Blackfoot will overtake.
If they pursue us, let us go in a different direction.
The Blackfoot will not see us.”
“Very well,” said the young men.
So they fled.
They fled in a different direction.

sentences.original: tâpwêh êh-wâpahk kiskêyihtamwak iyâhciyiniwak êh-kimotamâhcik otêmiwâwah.
sentences.text: tâpwê ê-wâpahk kiskêyihtamwak ayahciyiniwak ê-kimotamâhcik otêmiwâwa
sentences.english: As they had foreseen, in the morning the Blackfoot saw that their horses had been stolen from them.

sentences.original: wawêyîwak, êh-âh-awihitocik otêmiwawah, ê-pimitisahwâcik nêhiyawah, êkwah kapê-kîsik êh-pimipayicik, nêhiyawah ê-wîh-kakwêy-atimâcik.
sentences.text: wawêyîwak ê-âh-awihitocik otêmiwâwa ê-pimitisahwâcik nêhiyawa êkwa kapê-kîsik ê-pimipayicik nêhiyawa ê-wî-kakwê-atimâcik
sentences.english: They made ready, lending one another horses, and went in pursuit of the Cree, riding all day to overtake them.
At last night came.
They had no sight of the Cree.
Still they went on, seeking to get sight of the Cree.

sentences.original: êh-wâpahk êkwah mînah êh-sipwêhtêcik, êh-pimitisahwâcik nêhiyawah, kîtahtawê kâ-wâpamâcik;
sentences.text: ê-wâpahk êkwa mîna ê-sipwêhtêcik ê-pimitisahwâcik nêhiyawa kîtahtawê kâ-wâpamâcik
sentences.english: In the morning, when again they set out in pursuit of the Cree, suddenly they saw them;

sentences.original: itah ê-wîh-mîcisocik nêhiyawak, pêyak mostoswah ê-nipahâcik, êkotah kâ-wâpamâcik iyâhciyiniwak ôhi nêhiyawah.
sentences.text: ita ê-wî-mîcisocik nêhiyawak pêyak mostoswa ê-nipahâcik êkota kâ-wâpamâcik ayahciyiniwak ôhi nêhiyawa
sentences.english: where the Cree were about to eat, having slain a buffalo, there the Blackfoot caught sight of the Cree.
They attacked them while they were eating.

sentences.original: êkwah ôkih nêhiyawak pasikôwak, êh-otinâcik misatimwah, êh-têhtapicik, êh-tapasîcik.
sentences.text: êkwa ôki nêhiyawak pasikôwak ê-otinâcik misatimwa ê-têhtapicik ê-tapasîcik
sentences.english: The Cree jumped to their feet, seized the horses, mounted, and fled.
Some of them fought; they shot at the Blackfoot.
The Blackfoot, too, kept shooting at them.
For a long time they fought each other as they went along.
One Cree was killed.

sentences.original: êkosi poyowak iyâhciyiniwak, nêhiyawah pêyak ê-nipahâcik.
sentences.text: êkosi poyowak ayahciyiniwak nêhiyawa pêyak ê-nipahâcik
sentences.english: Then the Blackfoot ceased, when they had killed one Cree.
The Blackfoot ceased fighting and went home.

sentences.original: êkwah ôki ôhpimê kâ-pimohtêcik nêhiyawak, êwakô kisêyiniw aw itah kâ-wîcihiwêt, kâw êkotah itohtêwak, owîcêwâkaniwâwah mêskanaw ê-wîh-kakwê-wâpahtahkik, itah ê-kîh-pimohtêyit.
sentences.text: êkwa ôki ohpimê kâ-pimohtêcik nêhiyawak êwako kisêyiniw awa ita kâ-wîcihiwêt kâwi êkota itohtêwak owîcêwâkaniwâwa mêskanaw ê-wî-kakwê-wâpahtahkik ita ê-kî-pimohtêyit
sentences.english: As for those Cree who had gone off in another direction, the party of that old man, they went back to look for the tracks of their comrades.
They saw the place where the others had gone by.

sentences.original: âh, oskinîkîtik, itwêw awa kisêyiniw, namoya êko-tahtoh ôhc ihtasiwak;
sentences.english: “Now, young men,” said the old man, “there were not so many of them as this;

sentences.original: osâm mistahi oki misatimwak kâ-pimiskanawêcik, itwêw awah kisêyiniw.
sentences.english: too many tracks have the horses made by here,” said the old man.

sentences.original: oskinîkiwak ôkih omis îtêwak : êko-tahto oma kâ-kîh-otinâcik misatimwah, itêwak ôhô kisêyiniwah.
sentences.text: oskinîkiwak ôki ômisi itêwak itêwak ôho kisêyiniwa
sentences.english: The young men answered him, “This is the number of the horses they have taken,” said they to the old man.
So they spoke.
Again they set out.

sentences.original: namôya wâhyaw êh-ihtâcik, kâ-pê-sâkêwêyit, êh-nakiskawâcik, êh-kîwêyit ow iyâhciyiniwah.
sentences.text: namôya wâhyaw ê-ihtâcik kâ-pê-sâkêwêyit ê-nakiskawâcik ê-kîwêyit awa ayahciyiniwa
sentences.english: They were not far on their way, when they encountered those Blackfoot coming out from behind a hill on their way home.
Thus they were seen by the others.
The Cree fled.
The others attacked them.
They took refuge with their horses in a wooded place.
They stayed in the brush.
The Blackfoot surrounded them.

sentences.original: wâtihkêwak êkota sakâhk, êkotah awa kisêyiniw êh-wîh-apit wâtihkânihk, êkwah pêyak oskinîkiw.
sentences.text: wâtihkêwak êkota sakâhk êkota awa kisêyiniw ê-wî-apit wâtihkânihk êkwa pêyak oskinîkiw
sentences.english: They dug a pit there in the woods, for the old man to stay in, and the one young man.

sentences.original: êkwah nîso ôk ôskinîkiwak namôya wîh-apiwak wâtihkânihk, êkwah êh-pâskisokocik ayâhciyiniwah.
sentences.text: êkwa nîso ôki oskinîkiwak namôya wî-apiwak wâtihkânihk êkwa ê-pâskisokocik ayahciyiniwa
sentences.english: The other two young men decided not to stay in the pit when the Blackfoot fired on them.

sentences.original: pêyak ômisi isiyîhkâsôw : kiyâhkâkiyowêw isiyihkâsôw; êkwah pêyak pâhpâscês isiyihkâsôw.
sentences.text: pêyak ômisi isiyîhkâsôw kiyâhkakiyôwêw isiyîhkâsôw êkwa pêyak pâhpâscês isiyîhkâsôw
sentences.english: The one's name was Kiyahkakiyowew, the other's Pahpastches.
Those were the two Cree who fought.
Two sat in the pit;

sentences.original: êwakonik êh-pîhtâsocik pâskisikanah, ôki kâ-nôtinikêcik êh-âpacihtâcik, kâh-tasinahkwâwih kâ-isiwêpinamawâcik ôhi kisêyiniwah, kotak êh-otinahk pâskisikan.
sentences.text: êwakonik ê-pîhtâsocik pâskisikana ôki kâ-nôtinikêcik ê-âpacihtâcik kâ-tasinahkwâwi kâ-isiwêpinamawâcik ôhi kisêyiniwa kotak ê-otinahk pâskisikan
sentences.english: they loaded the guns for those who were fighting, the latter tossing the guns, when they had fired them, to the old man, and taking another.

sentences.original: êwakonik ôki oskinîkiwak, kîspin êkâh êh-kostikocik iyâhciyiniwah, êyakoni êh-nipahâcik.
sentences.text: êwakonik ôki oskinîkiwak kîspin êkâ ê-kostikocik ayahciyiniwa êwakoni ê-nipahâcik
sentences.english: These young men, whenever a Blackfoot failed to keep at a cautious distance, him they killed.
But the others killed all their horses.
At last they had killed many Blackfoot.
The others came to fear them.

sentences.original: kêkâc êh-tipiskâyik, êkoyikohk poyôyiwah ôh iyâhciyiniwah, êh-tapasiyit, êh-sêkihâcik.
sentences.text: kêkâc ê-tipiskâyik êkoyikohk pôyoyiwa ôhi ayahciyiniwa ê-tapasîyit ê-sêkihâcik
sentences.english: Almost at nightfall the Blackfoot quit and ran away; they had frightened them.
Only one of these men had been slain.
Then when the others had run away and they looked at their horses,

sentences.original: awa kisêyiniw kâ-kîh-miyiht misatimwah, êwako pikoh pimâtisiyiwah, ês êh-kawipitisowit, oskâtiyihk êh-tapakwâtahk pîsâkanâpiy ohci awa misatim.
sentences.text: awa kisêyiniw kâ-kî-miyiht misatimwa êwako piko pimâtisiyiwa êsa ê-kawipitisoyit oskâtiyihk ê-tâpakwâtahk pîsâkanâpiy ohci awa misatim
sentences.english: only the horse which had been given to the old man was alive; it had apparently thrown itself down on the ground by getting its foot snagged in the tether.
sentences.footnote: LB on {êh-tapakwâtahk}:  This word is probably wrongly recorded; the translation is a guess.

sentences.english: Thus the old man took it.
So the Cree set out for home.
Only one of the four Cree was slain.
But certainly they had slain many of the Blackfoot.
They ceased fighting when they had frightened them off.
So they saved their lives.

sentences.original: êkosi êh-wâpahk, kapê-tipisk êh-pimohtêcik, êh-wâpahk, êh-otâkosihk, takosinwak wîkiwâhk ôki nêhiyawak.
sentences.text: êkosi ê-wâpahk kapê-tipisk ê-pimohtêcik ê-wâpahk ê-otâkosihk takosinwak wîkiwâhk ôki nêhiyawak
sentences.english: On the next day, after marching all night, in the evening these Cree reached their camp.

sentences.original: wiya piko awa kisêyiniw pêyak pêsiwêw ôhi misatimwah.
sentences.text: wiya piko awa kisêyiniw pêyak pêsiwêw ôhi misatimwa
sentences.english: Only the old man brought home his horse.

sentences.original: ôki wiyah oskinîkiwak kahkiyaw nipahêyiwah otêmiwâwah yâhciyiniwa.
sentences.text: ôki wiya oskinîkiwak kahkiyaw nipahêyiwa otêmiwâwa ayahciyiniwa
sentences.english: The young men's horses had all been killed by the Blackfoot.
That is the end of this story.
